title: The X Factor Celebrity line up comes out for show launch
text:
Ricki Lake brought a special friend to the X Factor launch (Picture: PA)

The stars of The X Factor Celebrity were out in force at the show’s launch on Wednesday.

Stars from Love Island, Coronation Street and Strictly Come Dancing walked the red carpet to promote the special version of the singing contest.

Also posing for the cameras was US talk show host Ricki Lake, who was nearly upstaged by her adorable four-legged companion.

Ricki looked amazing as expected with her cute dog in her arms, being very well-behaved.

Love Island stars Samira Mighty, Eyal Booker, Zara McDermott and Wes Nelson were there on the day to talk up their group The Islanders – even if Wes can’t stand the name.

Megan McKenna was all smiles for the camera amid her possible success on the show, hinted at by recent pictures of her welcoming judge Louis Walsh to her home as they filmed scenes together.

Advertisement

Advertisement

The X Factor will look a bit different to the usual series – besides the famous contestants.

She was almost upstaged by her four legged friend (Picture: REX)

Too cute! (Picture: REX)

Eyal Booker, Samira Mighty, Zara McDermott and Wes Nelson pose up on the red carpet (Picture: REX)

Influencers Sofia Oliviera, Wendii Sarmiento, Laura Buitrago and Alondra Martinez attended the launch (Picture: Empics)

Sports stars Thom Evans, Levi Davis and Ben Foden (Picture: Empics)

Brendan Cole and Jeremy Edwards have a laugh (Picture: WireImage)

Judge Louis Walsh has revealed that two of the show’s most-loved segments have been axed.

In the new series viewers won’t get to see with the boot camp stage or the incredibly tense six chair challenge.

The six chair challenge saw the judges whittle down which acts they were going to take through to judges’ houses by offering them a ‘chair’ in their line up of finalists.

It’s likely this part has been thrown out as there aren’t enough contestants to make the six chair challenge enough of a battle.

Has Jenny Ryan got pipes? (Picture: REX)

Judge Nicole Scherzinger bringing it as usual (Picture: REX)

Louis explained: ‘What we’re doing this year I think is a brilliant idea. I think everyone’s going to love watching these celebrities because it’s not what people expect.

‘Some of them are really good. The show feels more exciting. There’s no Bootcamp, no Six-Chair Challenge, it feels slick this year.

‘It’s been the best show on TV for a long time and has just had a little rebranding, I suppose, a new X Factor.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

The music manager joins Simon Cowell and Nicole Scherzinger on the judges’ panel.

A new trailer for the show saw Simon, Nicole and Louis listening to the celebs do their thing in a luxury Hollywood venue, which we think is a fair replacement for judges’ houses.

Reality TV star Megan, Glee’s Kevin McHale, EastEnders’ Jonny Labey will all be competing in the Unders category. The Overs is comprised of journalist Martin Bashir, actress Victoria Ekanoye and TV presenter Ricki.

In the groups will be a Love Island supergroup comprised of Wes Nelson, Samira Mighty, Eyal Booker and Zara McDermott. Ben Foden, Thom Evans and Levi Davis will be teaming up for a group, along with Brendan Cole and Jeremy Edwards.

The X Factor Celebrity starts Saturday at 8.35pm on ITV.

description: Ricki Lake and Love Island stars lead the way as The X Factor Celebrity line up comes out for show launch
